text: Azita Raji (, September 29, 1961 - February 8, 2022) was an Iranian-born American politician, banker, and philanthropist. She was nominated by President Barack Obama in October 2014 to serve as the United States Ambassador to Sweden. She was confirmed by the United States Senate in February 2016. Her term ended on January 20, 2017. In 2016, Raji read Bob Dylan's letter to the Nobel Committee on his behalf in Stockholm, in recognition of Dylan being awarded the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature. Raji died on February 8, 2022 in Belvedere, California from breast cancer at the age of 60. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:American philanthropists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Iranian politicians Category:Iranian businesspeople Category:Politicians from California Category:Businesspeople from California Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:Deaths from breast cancer
title: Azita Raji
